head.supplied: Melbourne botanic garden ¶ 20 January 1858. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that it would be very desirable to extend the botanical examination of our colony to the sources of the La Trobe ...

div.p: F58/735, unit 745, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS written by Carl Wilhelmi and signed by M. See also M to W. Haines, 20 January 1858.
This letter was also registered in the Public Works Department as No. 372, unit 4, VPRS 963, PROV. Melbourne botanic garden

I have the honor to inform you, that it would be very desirable to extend the botanical examination of our colony to the sources of the La Trobe river, and I beg to solicit your permission for leaving the botanical gardens for a period of not exceeding two weeks, in order to performe this labour. Should this application be favoured with your sanction, I would propose to start before the end of this week.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humblest servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: The honorable the Chief Commissioner of public Works &c. &c. &c.
